answers.answer: Hi,Tingling and numbness feeling is mainly due to nerve pathology like compression.It is advisable to consult an orthopedic surgeon/general surgeon before meeting an neurologist.

Hi,How are you feeling now?Any type of tingling, burning, or numbness is usually a symptom related to a sensory nerve being damaged, diseased, or injured. The main nerve involved is Sciatic nerve. Any infection at the root of nerve or compression will cause similar lesion.This peripheral nerve pathology can be due to Diabetes, Prediabetes, vitamin deficiency or any nutritional deficiency.Lower back strain can cause similar concern.I think you should consult physician and if required neurologist.Bye.

Hello,Thanks for all of ur comments.I saw a neurologist in sept.  I had hyperreflexia in my left knee, so i had an mri of the lumbar spine.They told me i had arthritis, but i left with so many unanswered questions.  Does it sound like MS or anything like that. I have just been really concerned.  They checked my blood for vitamin deficiencies and all came back normal.  The mri didn't show anything wrong with my back.Thanks Again,

Hi kay,Your symptomatology does not sound like you are having MS.There are definitive guidelines, on which the diagnosis of Multiple Sclerosis is based.Once internationally accepted criteria’s are satisfied, then diagnosis of multiple diagnosis can be made.There are definitive lesions (suggestive of MS) on MRI also.Follow the instruction of your neurologist.If any annoying symptoms develop, then re-evaluation is needed for your cause.Hope this helps you.Bye.

Hi.It would be premature to consider a diagnosis of MS at this time, especially without any brain MRI or other ancillary procedure findings to support it.It would be advisable to observe your symptoms for the moment and see if any worsening of symptoms, or development of new symptoms occur.Good luck.

question: What could be the problem.  I have had tingly toes almost every morning for the past year.  Numbness and weakness in both of my legs mainly my left. The toes that tingle are the two next to the baby toe on the left foot.Thanks so much for ur imput!!
